meanings.definition: To process or prepare something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Before cooking the pasta, you need to preprocess the ingredients.
meanings.sent2: It is important to preprocess the data before running the analysis.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to preprocess the vegetables by chopping them into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent4: She likes to preprocess her thoughts before making an important decision.
meanings.sent5: Remember to preprocess the documents before submitting them for review.

meanings.definition: The action or process of preparing something beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The preprocess of the project involved gathering all necessary materials.
meanings.sent2: Effective preprocess can save time and effort in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The team's preprocess of setting up the equipment was surprisingly efficient.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous preprocess of organizing the files impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The preprocess of setting up the event took longer than expected.
